intro: Oreobroma bernardinum, commonly known as the Florida star-of-Bahia, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of Florida. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in sandy soils along the shores and is adapted to salt spray and wind. It has small, narrow leaves and produces fruiting heads that contain numerous seeds. Oreobroma bernardinum is a rare and endangered species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts in its native habitat.
